intro: Stephanotella killipii, commonly known as the Killip's stephanotis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are often woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
